3.title: Technical Leadership Foundations
3.goal: Develop the mindset and toolkit for transitioning from individual contributor to effective engineering leader.

books.title: The Manager's Path
books.author: Camille Fournier
books.summary: A practical guide to growing as an engineering leader, covering mentoring, managing teams, and organizational structure.

books.title: An Elegant Puzzle: Systems of Engineering Management
books.author: Will Larson
books.summary: Explores engineering management at scale, providing frameworks for team organization, growth, and effective leadership.

3.title: Building and Leading Effective Teams
3.goal: Create high-performing teams with healthy culture, feedback, and motivation.

books.title: Team Topologies
books.author: Matthew Skelton & Manuel Pais
books.summary: Explains how to design teams for fast flow and organizational effectiveness, introducing team types and interaction modes.

books.title: Radical Candor
books.author: Kim Scott
books.summary: Shows leaders how to care personally and challenge directly, fostering honest communication and strong relationships.

books.title: Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us
books.author: Daniel H. Pink
books.summary: Explores the science of motivation, focusing on autonomy, mastery, and purpose as drivers of high performance.

3.title: Product Vision, Strategy, and Innovation
3.goal: Master product thinking, customer focus, and market strategies for technology leadership.

books.title: Inspired: How To Create Products Customers Love
books.author: Marty Cagan
books.summary: A comprehensive guide to building products customers want, from idea to launch, emphasizing customer discovery and product teams.

books.title: Crossing the Chasm
books.author: Geoffrey A. Moore
books.summary: Classic book on taking new technology to mainstream markets, focusing on the challenges of moving from early adopters to the majority.

books.title: The Lean Startup
books.author: Eric Ries
books.summary: Lays out a scientific approach to creating and managing successful startups through continuous innovation and validated learning.

3.title: Business, Scaling, and Execution
3.goal: Gain the tools to align technology and business, scale organizations, and drive measurable outcomes.

books.title: High Output Management
books.author: Andrew Grove
books.summary: Legendary management book focusing on the principles of effective operations, productivity, and scaling organizations.

books.title: Measure What Matters
books.author: John Doerr
books.summary: Explains how to use Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) to focus, align, and achieve breakthrough results in any organization.
